p: ZIKV is of African origin, but an Asian lineage emerged presumably in the first part of the XIX th century [ 6] and the viruses that spread in the Pacific and the Americas are descendants of this lineage. In addition to the classical picture of large arboviral outbreaks, significant public health burden was endured in Polynesia and America when severe and formerly undescribed foetal and neurological complications of the disease [ 12] as well as non-vectored routes of transmission [ 13] were reported.
